title: 'I don't think Trump is the future': Voters on 2024 run
description: The BBC asked former Trump voters: Would you support him if he runs for the White House in 2024?

title: Estee Lauder to buy designer brand Tom Ford
description: The cosmetics giant will purchase the designer fashion brand for £2.4bn.

title: UK Snooker Championship 2022: Judd Trump beats Xiao Guodong
description: Judd Trump puts his "atrocious" UK Championship record behind him to beat China's 6-5 Xiao Guodong in a final-frame decider to reach the last 16.

title: Rishi Sunak to meet Xi Jinping at G20 summit
description: The prime minister will call for a "frank and constructive relationship" between the UK and China.

title: Baby elephant interrupts Kenyan TV report
description: Watch as Kenyan journalist Alvin Kaunda's reporting is interrupted by an inquisitive trunk.

title: What does Awaab Ishak's death tell us about England's housing?
description: Experts have complained for decades that millions are living in sub-standard or dangerous accommodation.

title: England 1-1 Norway: Lionesses complete 2022 unbeaten despite Ellie Roebuck error
description: European champions England complete their historic 2022 unbeaten following a 1-1 friendly draw with Norway in Murcia.

title: US midterms: Republicans nominate Kevin McCarthy for House leadership
description: The Republican House representative is on track to replace Nancy Pelosi as Speaker of the House.

title: Northern Ireland 1-0 Italy: Sarah McFadden scores famous winner in Belfast
description: Sarah McFadden scores a famous winner as Northern Ireland round out a historic 2022 with a 1-0 win over Italy at Seaview.

title: Ryan Reynolds speaks Welsh during awards acceptance
description: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney have been given an award by S4C for promoting Wales.

title: Matt Hancock on I'm A Celebrity led to dozens of complaints to MPs' watchdog
description: Parliament's standards chief Kathryn Stone says she cannot investigate as the MP did not break any rules.

title: Kari Lake defeat: Did democracy win in US midterms?
description: Trump-backed election deniers who wanted to influence the rules of future votes were mostly defeated.

title: World Cup 2022: England arrive in Qatar ready for 'pinnacle of world football'
description: The England squad has arrived in Qatar for the Fifa World Cup ready to test themselves at the 'pinnacle of world football'

title: Beyoncé and Adele dominate Grammy Award nominations
description: Beyoncé is now tied with her husband Jay-Z as the most-nominated artist in Grammy Award history.

title: Twirls substituted in some Heroes chocolate boxes
description: The chocolate is another casualty of supply chain disruptions blighting manufacturers.

title: How you're born alters vaccines' power
description: The types of good bacteria which colonise our bodies at birth could influence how well vaccines work.

title: What is income tax and how could it change?
description: Income tax is an amount you pay to the government out of money you earn.

title: Scottish parliament apologises after suffragette scarf row
description: A woman was removed from a committee examining gender recognition reforms for wearing a scarf in the suffragette colours.

title: Over a million are owed money by failed crypto exchange
description: Experts and watchdogs warn UK investors that when crypto firms fail, getting money back is unlikely.

title: Women's Rugby League World Cup: England coach Craig Richards leaves role
description: The RFL confirm England head coach Craig Richards has left his role following his side's 20-6 Women's World Cup semi-final defeat by New Zealand on Monday.

title: Matt Hancock: Covid campaigners fly banner over I'm A Celebrity jungle
description: Covid family groups fly a message for the former health secretary over the I'm A Celebrity camp.

title: Tyson Fury says he 'needs to fight Anthony Joshua' before he retires
description: WBC heavyweight champion Tyson Fury says he "needs" to fight fellow Briton Anthony Joshua before he retires.

title: Hitmen jailed after gangster rap shooting boast in Glasgow
description: John McCann and Anton Brannigan blasted two men with a sawn-off shotgun as they sat in a parked van.

title: Lost dog 'hands itself in' at Loughborough Police Station
description: CCTV footage shows the moment Rosie arrived and waited for officers.

title: In Pictures: Inside the floating polar research laboratory
description: The RRS Sir David Attenborough is poised to return to Antarctica later this month.

title: Mark Brown: Murder-accused strung victim along, court hears
description: Mark Brown told a court he and Leah Ware would argue over his refusal to leave his partner.

title: Kyiv attacked as world leaders meet at G20
description: Kyiv has been attacked by missiles, the city's mayor says, as world leaders condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine

title: What do we know will be in the Autumn Statement?
description: Jeremy Hunt is expected to dismantle his predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng plans announced two months ago.

title: Aaron Lennon retires: Former England winger says 'the time is right'
description: Former Tottenham winger Aaron Lennon, who won 21 caps for England, says "the time is right to hang my boots up".

title: Suffolk Police apology over sex abuse victims' data on website
description: A police investigation is launched after the personal details of sexual abuse victims appear online.

title: UK's reputation has taken a knock, admits Rishi Sunak
description: The prime minister warns of a "difficult" economic outlook ahead of Thursday's autumn statement.

title: L﻿en Goodman stands down from Dancing With The Stars
description: The former Strictly Come Dancing head judge is now also stepping away from its US counterpart.

title: No uniform choice for Virgin Atlantic crew on World Cup flight
description: The airline's gender-neutral uniform policy does not apply to staff flying the England team to Doha.

title: Russian anger as UN calls for reparations over invasion of Ukraine
description: In a largely symbolic move, the UN found that Russia should be held accountable for its conduct.

title: Man admits killing parents in Gloucestershire homes
description: William Warrington admits the manslaughter of Clive Warrington, 67, and Valerie Warrington, 73.

title: Pat Cummins: Australia Test and ODI captain withdraws from IPL because of "packed" schedule
description: Pat Cummins has withdrawn from the Indian Premier League (IPL) because of the "packed" international schedule.

title: Awaab Ishak: Mould in flat caused boy's death, coroner rules
description: Awaab Ishak's death should be a "defining moment for the housing sector", a coroner concludes.

title: Heinz, Dolmio and Anchor: Top food brands see prices soar
description: The price of some popular branded foods have as much as doubled in two years, Which? research suggests.

title: Top Gear: Sue Baker, who presented motoring show for 11 years, dies
description: Baker was a presenter on the show during the 1980s and was also a pioneering motoring journalist.

title: Wales v Georgia: Scarlets' Josh Macleod to make debut at number eight
description: Scarlets back row Josh Macleod will make his Test debut against Georgia in the unfamiliar role of number eight.

title: China zero Covid: Violent protests in Guangzhou put curbs under strain
description: Anger boils over in the industrial city of Guangzhou, exposing cracks in Xi Jinping's signature policy.

title: Faf du Plessis was 'jealous' of AB de Villiers & labels David Warner a 'bully'
description: Former South Africa captain Faf du Plessis says he was "jealous" of AB de Villiers and labels David Warner a "bully" in his new book.

title: Fight Talk: Natasha Jonas proves good things come to good people
description: The biggest talking points from the world of boxing, including reaction to Natasha Jonas winning the IBF light middleweight belt.

title: Record wage rises still outpaced by soaring inflation
description: Wages are rising at their fastest rate in more than 20 years, but still lag far behind the cost of living.

title: World Cup 2022: Beckham, Ronaldo, Ballack - Relive 10 defining goals from 2002 tournament
description: Before the 2022 World Cup, BBC Sport relives 10 goals that tell the story of the 2002 tournament - featuring memorable strikes from David Beckham, Ronaldo and Michael Ballack.

title: Qatar 2022: 'World Cup controversies take some excitement away' - Gabby Logan
description: BBC presenter Gabby Logan says the background to Qatar hosting the World Cup and the controversies surrounding the regime there make her feel uncomfortable about the whole occasion.

title: Trump ally Kari Lake loses to Democrat Katie Hobbs in Arizona governor race
description: Republicans are still slightly favoured to secure the 218 seats they need to win back the majority.

title: Civil service union urges complaints reform amid bullying claims
description: The call from the FDA comes after bullying allegations against Justice Secretary Dominic Raab.

title: Wagatha play won't punch down at Rebekah Vardy and Coleen Rooney, writer says
description: A play based on transcripts from the case will not belittle the two women involved, its writer says.

title: Shireen Abu Aqla: Israel won't cooperate with US death probe
description: Israel's defence minister says it won't aid any "external investigation" into Shireen Abu Aqla's death.

title: GTA: Rockstar rejected Eminem movie deal, says insider
description: A friend of Grand Theft Auto creators the Houser brothers says Hollywood wasted its one chance.

title: As the 8 billionth child is born, who were 5th, 6th and 7th?
description: The world is still growing, but not as fast as when the six- and seven-billionth babies were born.

title: Michelle Obama: Being kind to myself is a challenge
description: The ex-first lady tells the BBC about her negative thoughts about her appearance and "fearful mind".

title: Health bosses seek strike deal as talks take place
description: Unions to meet Health Secretary Steve Barclay as NHS managers warn strikes will be damaging to patients.

title: Ukraine's secret weapon - the medics in the line of fire
description: The BBC's Quentin Sommerville is with more than a dozen doctors and nurses who work and live together under fire.

title: The Papers: Living wage boost and council tax rise fears
description: Tuesday's front pages speculate on the government's spending plans ahead of Thursday's Autumn Statement.

title: Jacqueline Fernandez: The Bollywood actress caught up in a 'gifts scandal'
description: A court in India is set to rule on Jacqueline Fernandez's petition for bail on Tuesday.

title: Who will pay for Indonesia's clean energy bill?
description: The G20 is expected to unveil a climate deal to speed up Indonesia's transition to clean energy.

title: Somalia drought: One boy's fight to save his family from starvation
description: Dahir's brother died of hunger. Now two of his sisters are fighting sickness and malnutrition in Somalia.

title: COP27: Without Greta, activists make waves at climate summit
description: Young campaigners say they are calling out "greenwashing" at COP27 from the inside.

title: What to do with 18 shipping containers of rotting cabbages
description: The cargo salvage industry has a key role in global trade by dealing with unwanted containers.

title: Cost of living: Electric heaters may pose fire risks despite savings
description: The popularity of portable heaters to warm a single room has increased as energy bills have soared.
